questions.text: Is the character a hero (primarily)?
questions.style_guide: Anti-heroes count as hero if mostly portrayed as such.

questions.text: Does the character have superhuman abilities?
Is the character part of the X-Men?
Is the character part of the Ultimates (Avengers)?
Is the character primarily human (non-mutant, non-alien)?
Is the character a mutant?
Is the character primarily a villain?
Does the character use advanced technology/armor as a core trait?
Is the character a founding member of a major team (Ultimates, X-Men, FF)?
Is the character from the DC universe?
Is the character from the Marvel universe?
Is the character from an anime or manga franchise?
Is the character from a Western cartoon series?
Is the character primarily associated with the Avengers?
questions.style_guide: Any notable stint counts across canons.

questions.text: Is the character primarily associated with the Justice League?
questions.style_guide: Any notable stint counts across canons.

questions.text: Is the character a member of the Guardians of the Galaxy?
questions.style_guide: Any notable stint counts across canons.

questions.text: Does the character use magic or mystic arts?
questions.style_guide: Sorcery, chi, or supernatural magic as a core trait.

questions.text: Is the character an alien or non-human species?
Is the character a robot, android, or cyborg?
Does the character primarily fight with a sword?
questions.style_guide: Sword is a signature primary weapon.

questions.text: Is the character a pirate?
Is the character a ninja/shinobi?
Is the character a billionaire/industrialist?
questions.style_guide: Wealth and industry leadership central to identity.

questions.text: Is the character royalty (king/queen/prince/princess)?
Is the character primarily comedic/lighthearted in tone?
questions.style_guide: Generally portrayed for humor over drama.
